intro: Cordanthera, commonly known as the grassland bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are native to the temperate regions of the Americas, particularly in North America. Cordanthera species are typically herbaceous perennials with showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. They often grow in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and meadows. The genus is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered leaves.
